dismissalText.commentary: Marvan Atapattu c Taylor b Mason 28 (26b 5x4 0x6 23m) SR: 107.69

dismissalComment.html: Revenge! Atapattu falls after promising much more than 28. Soft dismissal. Fullish, on the legs, Atapattu flicks, in the air, and straight to the man standing behind square-leg.  He fell over a touch while trying to balance on his front foot and as a result he skewed it in the air. Atapattu is quite distraught with himself. He was looking so good out there but that's that. Sri Lanka lose their second wicket. Kumar Sangakkara is the new man in.

dismissalText.commentary: Tillakaratne Dilshan run out (JAH Marshall/†McCullum) 18 (41b 2x4 0x6 57m) SR: 43.9

dismissalComment.html: Dilshan has ran him self out. What a blow. New Zealand continue to dazzle on the field. Pushed to cover, Dilshan wants a run, sets off but there is no response from Maharoof. James Marshall, at cover, throws himself to hisleft to make a great stop and then sends in a quick throw to McCullum who flicks it on to the stumps

headshotImage.caption: KC Sangakkara headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: KC Sangakkara headshot

dismissalComment.html: Very sharp catch by Taylor. Huge wicket. Man-in-form Sangkkara falls. Short and on the middle and leg, Sangakkara leans back and pulls. It flew low towards Taylor, at square-leg, who bent low in front of him to scoop the ball inches above the ground.

headshotImage.caption: WU Tharanga headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: WU Tharanga headshot

dismissalComment.html: What a acrobatic catch by McCullum! New Zealand are right on top here. IT was banged in short, down the legside, Tharanga goes for a pull and the ball runs off the face of the bat and it could well have been a four if not for McCullum. He flung himself to his right, like a goalkeeper, to pull off a stunner. Super catch that. And Sri Lanka slip into further trouble.

headshotImage.caption: Chamara Silva player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Chamara Silva player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Mason nails another victim! He is on fire here. Cons  the batsman with slight change of pace. Short of length and Chamara de Silva just went through the line, on the up but only ended up patting it back to Mason who bent low, in front, to take a simple catch. New Zealand are all over Sri Lanka like a rash. Especially Mason.

headshotImage.caption: Farveez Maharoof player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Farveez Maharoof player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Another one bites the dust. Loopy delivery, well outside the offstump and Maharoof tries to fetch it from there and attempts a sweep shot. nicks it behind. Bad shot selection.

headshotImage.caption: Ruchira Perera player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ruchira Perera player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Sri Lanka have collapsed for 112. Tossed up, outside off, sliced straight to backward point. That caps up a dismal show. This is Sri Lanka's lowest total ever against New Zealand. Home and away.

dismissalText.commentary: Sanath Jayasuriya c †McCullum b Bond 0 (2b 0x4 0x6 6m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: Bond nails Jayasuriya! What a start for NZ! Excellent delivery. It landed on a length, around the offstump line, sucking Jayasuriya into a forward prod. He had to play at it and he did. The ball shaped away, took a bit of outside edge and flew to left of McCullum who took off in the air to take a smart catch.

dismissalText.commentary: Mahela Jayawardene run out (Vettori) 1 (16b 0x4 0x6 32m) SR: 6.25

dismissalComment.html: Sri Lanka sink into deeper crisis. Jayawardene is run out. Vettori is the man with the throw. Dilshan dabs a length-delivery towards midwicket and sets off for a single. Vettori moved to his right at midwicket, got down swiftly on to the ball and released it quickly. It was bang on the target and Jayawardene was just caught short of the crease

dismissalText.commentary: Brendon McCullum c Silva b Perera 22 (16b 1x4 2x6 19m) SR: 137.5

dismissalComment.html: Gone! Got im! McCullum perishes, trying to attack. Full and wide, McCullum, doesn't quite lean on to the shot, drives and sends it straight to Chamara Silva at cover. Silva timed his jump perfectly to take a neat catch. NZ three down and game on! We have another 10 minutes before the lunch break

dismissalComment.html: Another wicket! The drama continues at the Jade stadium. Vettori goes for a pull shot, top-edges it over and behind Sangakkara who runs back, waits for the swirling ball to come down and holds a tumbling catch.  Another 64 runs, another 6 wickets!

headshotImage.caption: Hamish Marshall player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Hamish Marshall player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Would you believe it? Another wicket has gone down on this strange strange day of cricket. And then there were four. Dragged back to the stumps. Short of length, outside off, Marshall stabs at it and ends up killing himself. The ball goes on the top of the middle stump. He tries desperately to prevent the mishap but  the ball beats him.  What drama here!

headshotImage.caption: Ruchira Perera player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: LRPL Taylor headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: LRPL Taylor headshot

dismissalComment.html: What a catch! Dilshan takes a beauty at backward point. Or does he? Taylor is squared-up pushing forward in defence at a delivery slanted away from him. The ball flies off the outer edge and to left of Dilshan who dives to low to his left, scoops up the ball on his left-hand,. it bobs up and Dilshan, now lying on his back, grabs it off the second attempt. Umpires have a chat and give it out. Replays tell a different story. When the ball bobbed up from the left palm, it touched the grass when Dilshan tried to grab it! Hmm........ The umpires didn't refer it upstairs and that's that

commentTextItems.html: Screaming pull shot for six! Fulton has won the game for New Zealand!  Banged in short, and Fulton swivels off his front foot and murders it over deep midwicket. Game over!

commentPostTextItems.html: What a strange game this was. A good toss to win, there was some movement and bounce but it was not a 112 pitch. Then, the target was revised by D/L method and New Zealand made heavy weather of what should have been a simple chase. Fulton guided the hosts home with an unbeaten 42 and as a result, New Zealand lead the five-match series 2-1. The next game is on the 6th at Auckland. Join us then. This is Sriram Veera, signing off.

commentTextItems.html: banged in short and well outside the offstump, swayed away without any fuss. Surely, Fernando will go for his yorker at some point
in the zone outside offstump, Fulton goes for a drive with a opened face of the bat and is beaten.
flatter, on the middle and offstump line, Franklin goes down on his front knee, attempts to sweep, doesn't connect and the ball runs of the back thigh,,, to the offside.

commentTextItems.html: doosra and Franklin is struck in the pad, pushing forward in defense. Point of impact was outside the offstump.
They are doing it in singles here. Tossed up on the middle stump, a offbreak, Fulton leans forward, turns it around the corner, with the spin.
Almost holed up toe the deep backward square-leg. Tossed up on middle and leg, Franklin sweeps, in the air, one bounce to that man in the deep. New Zealand inch closer.
from round the stumps, tossed up, lands outside leg, a doosra, Fulton leans forward, pushes it to the on side. only 8 runs needed
full in length, on the leg and middle, worked to midwicket.

commentTextItems.html: Another shortish and wide outside offstump, cut past point
banged in short of length, outside offstump, Franklin is offbalance when trying to force it off the back foot, ends up pushing it to cover
full and on the middle stump line, it goes on with the angle. Franklin leans forward, brings his bat around his front pad, pushes it out to Jayasuriya at mid-on
speared in full. 142 kmph. at the pads, Franklin pushes at it, and the ball raps him on the pads and bobs away to the on side
length-delivery, lands on the offstump line, goes on with the angle. dabbed down to thirdman. Just 11 runs now.
around offstump again, steered to the offside

commentTextItems.html: beaten! so close to that outside edge. Tossed up, lands around offstump, Franklin pushes at it and is beaten as the offbreak spins past his bat
Wide! Murali goes for a doosra but it goes spinning down leg side. Easy decision.
offbreak, around offstump, Franklin pushes forward in defense, the ball runs to backward point

dismissalText.commentary: Upul Tharanga c †McCullum b Mason 11 (34b 1x4 0x6 59m) SR: 32.35

dismissalComment.html: What a acrobatic catch by McCullum! New Zealand are right on top here. IT was banged in short, down the legside, Tharanga goes for a pull and the ball runs off the face of the bat and it could well have been a four if not for McCullum. He flung himself to his right, like a goalkeeper, to pull off a stunner. Super catch that. And Sri Lanka slip into further trouble.

dismissalText.commentary: Sanath Jayasuriya c †McCullum b Bond 0 (2b 0x4 0x6 6m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: Bond nails Jayasuriya! What a start for NZ! Excellent delivery. It landed on a length, around the offstump line, sucking Jayasuriya into a forward prod. He had to play at it and he did. The ball shaped away, took a bit of outside edge and flew to left of McCullum who took off in the air to take a smart catch.

dismissalText.commentary: Marvan Atapattu c Taylor b Mason 28 (26b 5x4 0x6 23m) SR: 107.69

dismissalComment.html: Revenge! Atapattu falls after promising much more than 28. Soft dismissal. Fullish, on the legs, Atapattu flicks, in the air, and straight to the man standing behind square-leg.  He fell over a touch while trying to balance on his front foot and as a result he skewed it in the air. Atapattu is quite distraught with himself. He was looking so good out there but that's that. Sri Lanka lose their second wicket. Kumar Sangakkara is the new man in.

dismissalText.commentary: Kumar Sangakkara c Taylor b Mason 15 (18b 3x4 0x6 19m) SR: 83.33

dismissalText.commentary: Mahela Jayawardene run out (Vettori) 1 (16b 0x4 0x6 32m) SR: 6.25

dismissalComment.html: Sri Lanka sink into deeper crisis. Jayawardene is run out. Vettori is the man with the throw. Dilshan dabs a length-delivery towards midwicket and sets off for a single. Vettori moved to his right at midwicket, got down swiftly on to the ball and released it quickly. It was bang on the target and Jayawardene was just caught short of the crease

dismissalText.commentary: Chamara Silva c & b Mason 4 (7b 1x4 0x6 10m) SR: 57.14

dismissalComment.html: Mason nails another victim! He is on fire here. Cons  the batsman with slight change of pace. Short of length and Chamara de Silva just went through the line, on the up but only ended up patting it back to Mason who bent low, in front, to take a simple catch. New Zealand are all over Sri Lanka like a rash. Especially Mason.

dismissalComment.html: Dilshan has ran him self out. What a blow. New Zealand continue to dazzle on the field. Pushed to cover, Dilshan wants a run, sets off but there is no response from Maharoof. dismissalComment.html: Sri Lanka have collapsed for 112. Tossed up, outside off, sliced straight to backward point. That caps up a dismal show. This is Sri Lanka's lowest total ever against New Zealand. Home and away.

dismissalText.commentary: Brendon McCullum c Silva b Perera 22 (16b 1x4 2x6 19m) SR: 137.5

dismissalComment.html: Gone! Got im! McCullum perishes, trying to attack. Full and wide, McCullum, doesn't quite lean on to the shot, drives and sends it straight to Chamara Silva at cover. Silva timed his jump perfectly to take a neat catch. NZ three down and game on! We have another 10 minutes before the lunch break

headshotImage.caption: TM Dilshan headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: TM Dilshan headshot

dismissalText.commentary: Ross Taylor c Dilshan b Perera 0 (4b 0x4 0x6 6m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: What a catch! Dilshan takes a beauty at backward point. Or does he? Taylor is squared-up pushing forward in defence at a delivery slanted away from him. The ball flies off the outer edge and to left of Dilshan who dives to low to his left, scoops up the ball on his left-hand,. it bobs up and Dilshan, now lying on his back, grabs it off the second attempt. Umpires have a chat and give it out. Replays tell a different story. When the ball bobbed up from the left palm, it touched the grass when Dilshan tried to grab it! Hmm........ The umpires didn't refer it upstairs and that's that

dismissalText.commentary: Daniel Vettori c †Sangakkara b Fernando 11 (15b 2x4 0x6 20m) SR: 73.33

dismissalComment.html: Another wicket! The drama continues at the Jade stadium. Vettori goes for a pull shot, top-edges it over and behind Sangakkara who runs back, waits for the swirling ball to come down and holds a tumbling catch.  Another 64 runs, another 6 wickets!

headshotImage.longCaption: TM Dilshan headshot

dismissalText.commentary: James Marshall c Dilshan b Muralidaran 5 (16b 0x4 0x6 17m) SR: 31.25

dismissalComment.html: The drama continues! New Zealand lose their fifth wicket. Tossed up on the off and middle stump line, Marshall leans forward, sweeps but fails to keep it down and sends it straight to Dilshan at square-leg. The rollercoaster ride at the Jade stadium is on full swing. Game on still.

headshotImage.longCaption: Dilhara Fernando player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Hamish Marshall b Fernando 4 (4b 1x4 0x6 4m) SR: 100

dismissalComment.html: Would you believe it? Another wicket has gone down on this strange strange day of cricket. And then there were four. Dragged back to the stumps. Short of length, outside off, Marshall stabs at it and ends up killing himself. The ball goes on the top of the middle stump. He tries desperately to prevent the mishap but  the ball beats him.  What drama here!

milestones.description: This is the lowest match aggregate (222) involving teams New Zealand & Sri Lanka in ODIs
Jayasuriya has broken the record for most ducks (29) in ODIs, going past Wasim Akram's 28

stories.title: NZ  scamper home in low-scorer
stories.subTitle: New Zealand v Sri Lanka, 3rd ODI, Christchurch
stories.seoTitle: Fulton guides NZ home in low-scorer
stories.summary: New Zealand survived a tense period immediately after lunch, during which they nearly threw away their tight grip on the match, to clinch a four-wicket victory in the third one-day international at Christchurch
